Curator's comments: Such naturally smoothed jasper pebbles are usually associated with cosmetic palettes and were used in conjunction with them to grind cosmetic ores. The pebble was found in a deposit together with three baskets, one of which contained two hard stone palettes (see EA59695-59696).
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 6, 35.)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
